full_text: (2.) Two PHOTOSTATIC Copies WAR OFFICE To:- Mr. I E - Cleary Formerly :- army NÂ°491546 Bdr, Hooyal Artilling You have been awarded a pension after twenty one years' service in the British Army. You have served under varying conditions in many different places. You have had to bear your share of the arduous duties which fall to the lot of the British Army, and you may justly claim to have played your part in upholding its age long traditions and, in so doing, strengthening the bonds of good will, which bind together the British Commonwealth of Nations. You have realised the meaning of loyalty and, above all, you will have acquired a lasting pride in your Unit, in your Regiment or Corps and in the Army. The Army Council take this opportunity of conveying to you VI their appreciation of your long and faithful service and their hope that all good fortune will be with you in the future. E.4. i and ORIGINAL CEEN AND that By Command of the Army Council. SIGNATURE OFVOFFICIAL myers uken I ogeth
